title: Mediaeater Digest Vol.30, No.199
content:
Privacy OpSec

Company squanders 3.6 billion people’s locations in Germany Data traders are spreading the locations of people in Germany – sometimes even for free, as research by netzpolitik.org and BR shows. A data set with 3.6 billion entries reveals precise movement profiles and a new dimension of mass surveillance.

How to tell if your online accounts have been hacked

AI/ML/Generative 

The making of Eno, the first generative feature film
Japanese media say AI search infringes copyright, urge legal reform
The golden age of scammers: AI-powered phishing

Andrej Karpathy “Excited to share that I am starting an AI+Education company called Eureka Labs.  The announcement:” We are Eureka Labs and we are building a new kind of school that is AI native.
author: MDG
